metadata.title: CVE-2018-1061 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - low
metadata.description:
python before versions 2.7.15, 3.4.9, 3.5.6rc1, 3.6.5rc1 and 3.7.0 isvulnerable to catastrophic backtracking in the difflib.IS_LINE_JUNK method. An attacker could use this flaw to cause denial of service.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-1061` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

idle-python2.7 - 2.7.12-1ubuntu0~16.04.4
libpython2.7 - 2.7.12-1ubuntu0~16.04.4
libpython2.7-minimal - 2.7.12-1ubuntu0~16.04.4
libpython2.7-stdlib - 2.7.12-1ubuntu0~16.04.4
libpython2.7-testsuite - 2.7.12-1ubuntu0~16.04.4
python2.7 - 2.7.12-1ubuntu0~16.04.4
python2.7-examples - 2.7.12-1ubuntu0~16.04.4
python2.7-minimal - 2.7.12-1ubuntu0~16.04.4
No subscription required

idle-python3.5 - 3.5.2-2ubuntu0~16.04.5
libpython3.5 - 3.5.2-2ubuntu0~16.04.5
libpython3.5-minimal - 3.5.2-2ubuntu0~16.04.5
libpython3.5-stdlib - 3.5.2-2ubuntu0~16.04.5
libpython3.5-testsuite - 3.5.2-2ubuntu0~16.04.5
python3.5 - 3.5.2-2ubuntu0~16.04.5
python3.5-examples - 3.5.2-2ubuntu0~16.04.5
python3.5-minimal - 3.5.2-2ubuntu0~16.04.5
python3.5-venv - 3.5.2-2ubuntu0~16.04.5
No subscription required

criterions.comment: python2.7 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.7.12-1ubuntu0~16.04.4').
python3.5 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.5.2-2ubuntu0~16.04.5').
